DataElement.preferredName: Cutaneous T-cell Lymphoma Response in Lymph Nodes Category
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Response category that describes the disease involvement in lymph nodes based on staging and classification criteria for cutaneous T-cell lymphoma (CTCL).

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Primary Cutaneous T-Cell Non-Hodgkin Lymphoma Global Response in Lymph Nodes
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A T-cell non-Hodgkin lymphoma arising from the skin. Representative examples include mycosis fungoides and primary cutaneous anaplastic large cell lymphoma._Criteria for the response to treatment in lymph nodes, as a component of global response.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A T-cell non-Hodgkin lymphoma arising from the skin. Representative examples include mycosis fungoides and primary cutaneous anaplastic large cell lymphoma.

Concepts.definition: A T-cell non-Hodgkin lymphoma arising from the skin. Representative examples include mycosis fungoides and primary cutaneous anaplastic large cell lymphoma.

Property.preferredDefinition: Criteria for the response to treatment in lymph nodes, as a component of global response.

Concepts.definition: Criteria for the response to treatment in lymph nodes, as a component of global response.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the response criteria (includes RECIST and others) and associated documentation of disease.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Created for NCI-INC0370865: 19C0076 qns curation request. 4.17.19 mc

ValueDomain.preferredName: Global Response in Lymph Nodes Category
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Criteria for the response to treatment in lymph nodes, as a component of global response._A grouping of items based on some commonality or by user defined characteristics.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Global Complete Response in Lymph Nodes

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Global Complete Response in Lymph Nodes
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: All lymph nodes are now 1.5 cm or less in greatest transverse (long axis) diameter by method used to assess lymph nodes at baseline or biopsy negative for lymphoma; in addition, lymph nodes that were N3 classification and 1.5 cm or less in their long axis and more than 1 cm in their short axis at baseline, must now be 1 cm or less in their short axis or biopsy negative for lymphoma.

Concepts.longName: Global Complete Response in Lymph Nodes
Concepts.definition: All lymph nodes are now 1.5 cm or less in greatest transverse (long axis) diameter by method used to assess lymph nodes at baseline or biopsy negative for lymphoma; in addition, lymph nodes that were N3 classification and 1.5 cm or less in their long axis and more than 1 cm in their short axis at baseline, must now be 1 cm or less in their short axis or biopsy negative for lymphoma.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Global Progressive Disease in Lymph Nodes

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Global Progressive Disease in Lymph Nodes
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: 50 percent or greater increase in the sum of products of diameter from baseline of lymph nodes; or any new node greater than 1.5 cm in the long axis or greater than 1cm in the short axis if 1-1.5 cm in the long axis that is proven to be N3 histologically; or loss of response with greater than 50 percent increase from nadir in sum of products of diameter of lymph nodes in those with partial response (whichever occurs first).

Concepts.longName: Global Progressive Disease in Lymph Nodes
Concepts.definition: 50 percent or greater increase in the sum of products of diameter from baseline of lymph nodes; or any new node greater than 1.5 cm in the long axis or greater than 1cm in the short axis if 1-1.5 cm in the long axis that is proven to be N3 histologically; or loss of response with greater than 50 percent increase from nadir in sum of products of diameter of lymph nodes in those with partial response (whichever occurs first).

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Global Partial Response in Lymph Nodes

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Global Partial Response in Lymph Nodes
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Cumulative reduction of 50 percent or more of the sum of products of diameter of each abnormal lymph node at baseline and no new lymph node greater than 1.5 cm in the diameter of the long axis or greater than 1.0 cm in the diameter of the short axis if the long axis is 1-1.5 cm diameter.

Concepts.longName: Global Partial Response in Lymph Nodes
Concepts.definition: Cumulative reduction of 50 percent or more of the sum of products of diameter of each abnormal lymph node at baseline and no new lymph node greater than 1.5 cm in the diameter of the long axis or greater than 1.0 cm in the diameter of the short axis if the long axis is 1-1.5 cm diameter.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Any new lymph node greater than 1.5 cm in the long axis in those with complete response proven to be N3 histologically.

Concepts.definition: Any new lymph node greater than 1.5 cm in the long axis in those with complete response proven to be N3 histologically.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Global Stable Disease in Lymph Nodes

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Global Stable Disease in Lymph Nodes
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Fails to attain the criteria for complete response, partial response, or progressive disease.

Concepts.longName: Global Stable Disease in Lymph Nodes
Concepts.definition: Fails to attain the criteria for complete response, partial response, or progressive disease.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the response criteria (includes RECIST and others) and associated documentation of disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Global Response in Lymph Nodes Category
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Criteria for the response to treatment in lymph nodes, as a component of global response.:A grouping of items based on some commonality or by user defined characteristics.

Concepts.definition: Criteria for the response to treatment in lymph nodes, as a component of global response.
A grouping of items based on some commonality or by user defined characteristics.
